positive.review:
I own the game, my friend gets the demo, we try playing together, he invites me, I get steam message to download trial. Okie dokie, no problem, I install that, and launch it, getting ready to play together. Demo version gives me a message, that I can't access the demo version, because I already have the full game. So I go back, thinking it would work now, maybe having the demo installed helps. It didn't, the full game kept putting me in the demo version, and the demo version kept sending me back to the full version. Why do you keep making decisions to shoot yourself in the foot, Saber? What is the reasoning behind this?

EDIT: Devs posted a post talking about it, don't use the Steam platform to join each other, but the code-based connection given in the game. Which, in hindsight, should have been talked about in a blog post at least. But I guess it works, and so I can recommend

fucking dope. idk why people would leave negative reviews for a free demo that has more content than some fully released games. Sure its not perfect. But is free and convinced me to buy the full game.

There’s a lot of content for a demo, i'm really impressed with everything.
The game feels great to play, the audio design is solid, and the visuals are stunning.
I was waiting for a sale since launch just to be sure, but this demo completely sold me.
I had a blast playing it.

The first five minutes pulled me into a world I haven’t felt in years.
The game captures something a lot of us have been missing — that feeling of being a walking tank, a human war machine tearing through enemies.

The brutality and the sheer weight of every hit are incredible. The combat feels heavy and satisfying, and the sound design adds so much to the atmosphere. It honestly felt like I was in a war movie, not a game.
I enjoyed it so much that I actually stopped playing just to wait for a friend, because there’s no way I’m finishing something like this alone.

The only downside so far is the FPS drops. You really need to adjust your settings before jumping in. I spent about 30 minutes testing different options until I found what works best for my setup.
No crashes yet, and even if one happens, it’s understandable — it’s still a demo and clearly being worked on.

If this demo is any indication of what’s coming, then the full release might be something special.

I really enjoyed this game! The combat was satisfyingly smooth. Felt like a Gears of War with an upgraded melee combat. Keeping on Wishlist until the price lowers but only because of finances. If I were better off I would have bought it in a heartbeat.

This demo is huge. It felt like it would never end, but that's a good thing. Combat, sound, and graphics were amazing. I've never really took the time to delve into Warhammer lore, but its beginning to seem interesting. Soon as I can clear some of my backlog im going to give this series a try.

Damn, this game is bad-ass. I downloaded the Demo just to see if the game ran on my "old" gaming laptop and I must say that I was very surprised that it ran and how good it ran. My Laptop is a Victus with an RTX 2050 4GB, 16Gb ram and an AMD Ryzen 5 7535HS and I was expecting to run like trash like it ran FF XVI, but man, it does run pretty good. I was running it at around 60 to 45 FPS (Mostly when the screen is filled with Tyranids) on Medium with low textures, Performace DLSS and at 1080p resolution.

So, if you have a laptop like mine and don't expect 4k, ultra at 60fps (Let's be honest, its a budget laptop, its kinda dumb to expect that) you can still have a pretty good experience

Will look into getting the full version in the future.

==
SP 1 comparison.
Just going to put this at the top now, as I went and looked at SP1 gameplay again. SP1 feels way better, the guns sound better, it's actually like you're shooting something, the combat - I remember when they first showed sneak peak demos of him caving through enemies all in sync and the slow motion on each one, blew people away, it's fucking great, it's much more Batman Arkham style. You feel like you are making choices and directions on purpose.

SP2 is more like dark tide I think or others of that kind. Which to me isn't great. Maybe it's the nature of fighting tyrranids and not orks but the hoard swarm isnt the same as those Gretchen swarms. It all needs a bit more weight, more slow mo on hits, more crushin. I don't know if they will change that now.

I can't say from the limited gameplay I've seen in person but the lots of videos online. It all looks good, but it feels different. I wish they'd go back to the older combat style. And make guns actually do something. i.e. https://youtu.be/2zNRtOhFq9Y?t=616 (10:16)

I'm sure the full game is good, and on a good system, but it's not the same from what I've seen.

===

This game taught me a I need a new computer. I'm on a laptop* but it should be able to run it on better graphics settings than low at 40fps.. 2560x1440p It's telling me I need more graphics memory, at least it's telling me that, and this is what the test is for. 

Still a bit disappointing, I wouldn't expect main game to be different since the demo is cut from it. I don't care about FPS so much 40 - 60 is good for me, just I know the game looks gorgeous when I turned it up to run at 2fps. So that's what you need.

Player agency exists during combat, but the levels are linear & rail-roady. I have a bolter and a chain sword, but I'm forced to watch a canned animation of my spess mahreen kicking or shoving an obstacle instead of going ham on it myself. There's a million more ways to make traversal actually fun. Like, let me do the hacking and the slashing? Combat relies on overlays for reading enemies more than utilization of the exquisite animations. I just feel like I'm going through the motions when the game allows it. Hold 'X' to skip.

This is *bad* game design that only serves to waste the player's time. My inputs feel so disconnected from the actions on screen during a hold, that I just think "wow, I could be doing something way more rewarding and productive than this, like washing my balls." There is never a second in this game when I wouldn't want to pick something up. I should be able to walk over things and eat them like I'm Pac-Man, not stopping to hold 'X' all the time. Wakka-wakka, motherfucker. Switching loadouts back would be as simple as walking over the thing I dropped. It's like they chose to pad runtime with button holding and watching canned anims and forgot this should be a controllable video game ass video game. Hold 'X' to skip.

Positive:
- Warhammer universe (I really like it). In this game, you continue Titus story.
- Demo very generous in time and content. Even can play Operations in multiplayer. Kudos for this!
- With friends is much more fun (I just play by matchmaking with strangers and still got more fun than playing alone)

Didn't like it so much:
- Optimization: for a game this old (already goes for patch number 10) it has a very poor performance. The first cinematic, I couldn't see it because the FPS dropped to 2 FPS. I am talking about the cinematic! With a 24GB VRAM card. Then the game I had to configure it in "quality" (that is the setting that have the least amount of scaling) to get a little more than 60 fps because in native (no scaling) was stuck at 35-40fps. The game looks OK, but it has not breathtaking photorealistic graphics that justify this resource consumption and poor performance. Optimization is just bad.

- Freedom: this game suffers all the console game vices. Linear levels, battle arenas, linear story, etc. Even the fighting now has the blue→parry, red→evade mechanic of all the console games I know. You start a level, follow the marker until an arena (you see it a mile away and just have to enter, no alternative path, no decision-making, no strategy. Do what you are told). Then you fight, waves and waves of enemies. The combat animations are slow (you have light and strong attacks), and more times than I can count, the red or blue indicators came in the middle of an animation of my light/strong attack so when you want to parry/evade is already too late. Your strong attacks are constantly interrupted for the same reason, the animations are too slooow... And that what has become standard nowadays! You have no freedom how to fight, you have to take care of the enemies they way the game want it. And I didn't progress much in the story, but I am sure that it has "the cinematic decide your destiny" console logic. That is when you have a fight that cost you a lot of effort, and you "win" but the cinematic decide that you loose because the history is that way. It happened in every consolish game I have played, and this it doesn't  seem to be the exception.

- Weapons: The weapons are from Warhammer universe and are nice, but also, they are effective just when the game want. The ranged weapons are weak and off course they become overwhelmed pretty quickly so you have to change to melee, another thing that you can't choose, and the game decide for you.

- Information: The game has a first mission that acts as a tutorial that is very complete, teaching you to block, to evade, etc... That is very well done and it's OK. But after that, there are some things that could be more informative. For example, middle of mission, I encounter a resupply box to change my weapon for another. Didn't have a compare feature or a way to see the stats of the weapon. I still don't know if in what situation I have to use the combat knife or the chainsaw sword. 

- Price: I would pay for this game on sale if the whole package cost like 15usd. But at the current price range with all the dlcs and different "versions" it is very expensive.

Unsharp, blurry, over-sharpened mess

The game looks like absolute garbage. It’s blurry and unsharp yet somehow still over-sharpened enough to make your eyes hurt and cause motion sickness. After a while, your eyes ache from all the ghosting, sharpening, and unstable clarity. In intense scenes you can barely tell what’s happening. Some areas in the game are actually beautiful but then completely ruined by this disgusting upscaled, over-sharpened TAA.

There’s no way to disable this trash TAA. No SMAA, no FXAA, not even an off option. You can only slightly counteract it with DSR or similar techniques since the game never lets you raise the internal resolution. This reduces the worst of the blur a little but introduces new problems such as over-sharpening, graininess, and ugly visuals. The game also has severe texture streaming issues. Some textures are already present but low quality, while others take a noticeable moment to fully load or pop in late, even on hardware that is more than capable. This is absolutely unacceptable.

The game crashes constantly. You can’t alt-tab without risking a crash and sometimes it dies the moment you press something.

Easy Anti-Cheat blocks any chance of fixing it yourself. Let us use ReShade and turn off the in-game AA so we can apply a proper SMAA or Anti-Aliasing that actually works.

To whoever at Saber thought it was a great idea to encrypt the engine or game config files so players can’t tweak anything, I hope your sleeves slide down every time you wash your hands.

This game is held back by lazy, clueless devs at Saber Interactive. Learn how to properly implement anti-aliasing like SMAA1x or SMAA2x or just let players disable it. Learn how to deliver real image quality, not this blurry shimmering mess, and make sure it scales from Full HD to 4K.

From now on, whenever I see your studio’s name on a game, I’ll stay far away. You’re one of the reasons modern gaming sucks!

Unsharp, blurry, over-sharpened mess

The game looks like absolute garbage. It’s blurry and unsharp yet somehow still over-sharpened enough to make your eyes hurt and cause motion sickness. After a while, your eyes ache from all the ghosting, sharpening, and unstable clarity. In intense scenes you can barely tell what’s happening. Some areas in the game are actually beautiful but then completely ruined by this disgusting upscaled, over-sharpened TAA.

There’s no way to disable this trash TAA. No SMAA, no FXAA, not even an off option. You can only slightly counteract it with DSR or similar techniques since the game never lets you raise the internal resolution. This reduces the worst of the blur a little but introduces new problems such as over-sharpening, graininess, and ugly visuals. The game also has severe texture streaming issues. Some textures are already present but low quality, while others take a noticeable moment to fully load or pop in late, even on hardware that is more than capable. This is absolutely unacceptable.

The game crashes constantly. You can’t alt-tab without risking a crash and sometimes it dies the moment you press something.

Easy Anti-Cheat blocks any chance of fixing it yourself. Let us use ReShade and turn off the in-game AA so we can apply a proper SMAA or Anti-Aliasing that actually works.

To whoever at Saber thought it was a great idea to encrypt the engine or game config files so players can’t tweak anything, I hope your sleeves slide down every time you wash your hands.

This game is held back by lazy, clueless devs at Saber Interactive. Learn how to properly implement anti-aliasing like SMAA1x or SMAA2x or just let players disable it. Learn how to deliver real image quality, not this blurry shimmering mess, and make sure it scales from Full HD to 4K.

From now on, whenever I see your studio’s name on a game, I’ll stay far away. You’re one of the reasons modern gaming sucks!
